page.title: 17THE END OF AN ERA.
page.content: On Thursday 4th June 1985,the whole of our community was saddened by the death of Mrs. Bella MacIntyre Bolton. She was 95 years old and the oldest member of the community. Until a few months ago she lived in the house in front of the school and next door to the local shop which was built by her father. She celebrated her 95th birthday in February and was delighted to hear a birthday wish on her favourite radio show. Bella was blind and could no longer watch TV or read books. Bella attended our school in 1895 and could describe clearly to the present school children, her strict head teacher and the conditions in the school room. She also remembered the drovers bringing the cattle from the north to cross Loch Awe to go to market in Stirling or Falkirk. We all learned a great deal from Bella.
